Event.0: Discovery of a new mostly underwater continent Zealandia in the South Pacific announced in research journal "GSA Today"
Event.1: Kosovo declared its independence from Serbia, though a number of countries refused to recognize the new republic; the International Court of Justice later ruled that Kosovo had not violated international law, but Serbia rejected that decision.
Event.2: An earthquake and an accompanying tsunami in Indonesia left 108 people dead, 423 injured, and 58 missing.
Event.3: Convicted serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer was sentenced to 15 consecutive life terms for a series of gruesome murders; he was later killed by a fellow prison inmate.
Event.4:
Vietnam invaded by China
After the Vietnam War, Vietnam bolstered its ties with the Soviet Union rather than with China, and, following a series of anti-Chinese, pro-Soviet maneuvers by Vietnam, China invaded its southern neighbour this day in 1979.
Event.5: British Parliament votes to join the European Common Market
Event.6: Golda Meir sworn in as the first female Prime Minister of Israel
Event.7: British Minister of Defense Harold Macmillan announced plans to develop and produce hydrogen bombs.
Event.8: Mike Souchak sets PGA 72-hole record of 257 (not broken until 2001)
Event.9: Natural history broadcaster David Attenborough (24) weds Jane Elizabeth Ebsworth Oriel
Event.10:
Huey P. Newton
American activist
was born
Event.11:
Jim Brown
American football player and actor
was born
Event.12:
Barry Humphries
Australian actor
was born
Event.13:
Hal Holbrook
American actor
was born
Event.14: 26th US President Theodore Roosevelt's daughter Alice marries in the White House
Event.15: Giacomo Puccini's opera "Madama Butterfly" premieres in Milan
Event.16: The National Congress of Parents and Teachers, better known as the Parent-Teacher Association (PTA), was founded in Washington, D.C., as the National Congress of Mothers.
Event.17:
Sir Ronald Aylmer Fisher
British geneticist and statistician
was born
Event.18: Sardines first canned by Julius Wolff in Eastport, Maine
Event.19: Columbia, South Carolina, burns down during American Civil War
Event.20: During the American Civil War, the Confederate Hunley became the first submarine to sink an enemy ship when it successfully attacked the USS Housatonic in the waters off Charleston, South Carolina.
Event.21: The British annexed most of what is now Sindh province in Pakistan after winning the Battle of Miani.
Event.22: Dutch ex-king Willem I marries Henriette d'Oultremont de Wégimont
Event.23: Holy Roman Emperor Maximilian II agrees to pay tribute to the Ottoman Empire for peace
